subject: p12475198
History: Year old man with hypoxemia and diffuse airspace opacities, Interval change.
Impression: Severe infiltrative pulmonary abnormality, stable on the left, more coalescent on the right. This is probably diffuse pneumonia or pulmonary hemorrhage in a patient with emphysema. Heart size is large but indeterminate because heart borders are obscured by lung abnormality. Transvenous right atrial and right ventricular pacer defibrillator leads follow their expected courses. Small if not moderate bilateral pleural effusion is presumed. There is no pneumothorax.
